meanings.definition: A set of locks for securing doors or other entryways.
meanings.sent1: The new apartment building had high-quality locksets on all the doors.
meanings.sent2: The locksmith recommended upgrading the old locksets on the front door.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to pick the locksets on the pantry door and steal some treats.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like a set of sturdy locksets, impossible to break through.
meanings.sent5: The shiny locksets gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The act of installing or replacing locks on doors.
meanings.sent1: He learned how to do locksets as part of his training to become a locksmith.
meanings.sent2: The locksets for the new office building were being installed by a professional team.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie had a hilarious scene where the characters tried to do locksets but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The locksets of responsibility weighed heavily on his shoulders as he took on the new role.
meanings.sent5: The precision required for perfect locksets was evident in the flawless workmanship of the locksmith.
